p: High moisture content promotes susceptibility to microbial activity and spoilage (Ponnusha, Subramaniyan, Pasupathi, Subramaniyan, & Virunandy, 2011). Desplatsia dewevrei leaves and fruits may be said to have appreciable moisture content in contrast to that recorded for albedo (Oikeh, Oriakhi, & Omoregie, 2013). However, apt drying of this D. dewevrei leaves and fruits is recommended especially when they are harvested for use as herbal remedies to preserve the integrity of the phytochemicals in them and also to prevent microbial attack leading to microbial growth and decay.
